channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very deep hole, plus more problems., 12th March
item.description:
Between Alma Rd and Morrisons, the whole stretch of Caernarvon Rd is in quite a state. In particular, at one of the two mini roundabouts, there is a 6”deep pothole which is very hard to avoid as it’s at the junction and in line with left wheels. Please cub this stretch be inspected, and consideration given to more substantial repair. I would suggest this is worse state than both Salisbury Ave and Robert Burns road which have both been resurfaced recently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 151 Caernarvon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cans and broken glass - again, 11th March
item.description:
Yet again idiots throwing their cans and bottles around on the bit of grass, outside the school and on both sides of the roads. Any chance of any council putting a bin there. Know the chances of these idiots putting empties in there are slim but you never know. Perhaps a bit of monitoring there for a bit wouldn't go amiss, same beer cans everytime so assuming the same idiot(s) are doing it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 39 Cornwall Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clanking drain, again., 10th March
item.description:
When the clanking drain was last fixed, it wasn't done properly, it continue to make a thunking noise. This was reported to the person in charge of overseeing the fix, yet ignored completely, without reply. As expected, over time, this problem has got worse and we're now back to loud clanking. Please can you fix it properly?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 162 London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
